A **potion of confusion** is a type of [potion](/wiki/Potion "Potion") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 Description](#Description)
- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [4 History](#History)
- [5 Messages](#Messages)
- [6 Variants](#Variants)
  - [6.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
- [7 References](#References)

## Generation

[Intelligent monsters](/wiki/Intelligent_monster "Intelligent monster") can generate with the potion as an [offensive item](/wiki/Offensive_item "Offensive item").[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

Mixing a potion of booze with a [potion of enlightenment](/wiki/Potion_of_enlightenment "Potion of enlightenment") via [dipping](/wiki/Dipping "Dipping") will [alchemize](/wiki/Alchemy "Alchemy") a potion of confusion.

## Description

Quaffing the potion will, unsurprisingly, leave you [confused](/wiki/Confused "Confused") for several [turns](/wiki/Turn "Turn"). The duration of the confusion depends on the [beatitude](/wiki/Beatitude "Beatitude") of the potion:[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

- blessed: 8–14 turns
- uncursed: 16–22 turns
- cursed: 24–30 turns

Dipping a [unicorn horn](/wiki/Unicorn_horn "Unicorn horn") into a potion of confusion will turn the potion into an uncursed [potion of water](/wiki/Potion_of_water "Potion of water"). Dipping the potion into a [potion of gain energy](/wiki/Potion_of_gain_energy "Potion of gain energy") or [potion of gain level](/wiki/Potion_of_gain_level "Potion of gain level") will alchemize the potion into either a [potion of booze](/wiki/Potion_of_booze "Potion of booze") or a [potion of enlightenment](/wiki/Potion_of_enlightenment "Potion of enlightenment").

Monsters will throw this potion at you, with similar effects if you are hit; inhaling the potion's [vapors](/wiki/Vapor "Vapor") confuses you for 1 to 5 turns.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3) Monsters that are hit with a potion are confused, subject to their [monster magic resistance](/wiki/Monster_magic_resistance "Monster magic resistance").[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

## Strategy

While the potion can be occasionally useful for [reading scrolls while confused](/wiki/Confusion#Confused_scroll_effects "Confusion"), there are many other sources of confusion that weigh less. As such, this potion tends to be thrown at monsters, or more frequently [polypiled](/wiki/Polypile "Polypile") or made into water.

## History

The potion of confusion first appears in Hack 1.21 and Hack for PDP-11, which are based on [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack"), and is included in the initial item list for [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0").

## Messages

- Huh, What? Where am I?

  You quaffed a potion of confusion.

- What a trippy feeling!

  As above while [hallucinating](/wiki/Hallucination "Hallucination").

- You feel somewhat dizzy

  You were hit by a thrown potion.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), the [Lawful Quest](/wiki/Lawful_Quest "Lawful Quest") has a 2⁄5 chance of generating a cursed potion of confusion among the items found in the Chamber of Junk.

## References

2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/potion.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 902](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/potion.c#L902)
